result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane R. Lamb

records.addlTxt: *Address already listed as this "new address" in the cases listed.
Notice of Hearing - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward

1:08 PM cases 22CM688, 21CM945, 22CF1042 called. Defendant Shane R. Lamb in court.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Shane R. Lamb.  Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin.  
In 22CF1042: State asks court find a transactional relationship between counts 1 and 2 of the criminal complaint. Defense objects. Court summarizes a transactional relationship definition and finds counts 1 and 2 transactionally related after reading the criminal complaint. 
State calls Officer Stensen to testify- is sworn and testifies. Record to reflect identification of the defendant by Officer Stensen. 
Cross examination by the Defense. Witness is released. 
State asks for bind over. Defense has no argument. 
Court binds matter over to Branch 4 for ARGN. 
Defendant needs to be fingerprinted in 22CF1042.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:44 AM cases 21CM945, 22CF1042, 22CM688 called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Shane R. Lamb in court with Attorney Zebulon Patek. Attorney Patek was not aware of new file as he has not yet been appointed to it. Preliminary hearing date is requested by counsel for 22CF1042, other files are to ride along.
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Hearing and Notice of Assignment of Judge to Defendant. USPS indicates not deliverable as addressed; return to sender; unable to forward.

ADDRESS INFO for Shane R. Lamb
Current: 2110 Western Ave, Eau Claire, WI 54703 United States  (Effective: 09-20-2022)
Prior: 649 Kennedy Ct, Fall Creek, WI 54742

Notice of Hearing, Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Forward Time Expired
*Re-sent to address per USPS

Conditions: 
No contact with S.L. (victim) or S.L.'s residence, officers Kelly Stensen or Grant Kjelberg unless in an official capacity. 
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.

(Case called at 11:02 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Shane Lamb appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. District Attorney Peter Rindal appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 09/14/2022 at 1:30 PM. 
Hearing: 10/03/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with S.L. (victim) or S.L.'s residence, officers Kelly Stensen or Grant Kjelberg unless in an official capacity.
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer.
